count.description: The total number of objects that can be requested.

offset.description:
offset is used to skip that many number of objects before counting.
For example, if there are 2000 objects,
The first request will have offset as 0 and limit as 1000 to return first 1000 objects.
The second request will have offset as 1000 and limit as 1000 to return next 1000 objects.

id.description:
This id prodvided by Fyle to identify an employee from this organisation.
This id is always prefixed with `ou`.
This id is unique per organisation per email.

user_id.description:
This id helps to identify employees in other organisations.
This id is always prefixed with the string `us`.
This id is unique per email.

email.description: An immutable field that represents the email address of the employee. Must be compliant with RFC 822.

code.description:
This field refers to any string that the client programs can use to refer to an employee's unique id.
This could be any field such as an UUID from an Active Directory server or employee id in a HRMS system.

full_name.description: Represents the full name of the employee. Must be at least 3 characters.

created_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 compliant timestamp. Shows when this employees entry was created.

updated_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 compliant timestamp. Shows when this employees entry was updated.

email_verified_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 compliant timestamp. Shows when this email was verified in Fyle.

is_onboarded.description: This flag indicates whether an employee has completed the onboarding or not.

id.description: Unique identifier to a level object.

name.description: Level name of the employees

band.description: Band in which this level belongs to, you can group mulitple levels into a single band.

rank.description:
Rank in which this level belongs to. We recommend to assign higher rank for senior people in the org trees and
lower rank for employees in leaf of org tree.

id.description: Unique identifier to a department object.

mobile.description:
Mobile number of the employee.

spent_at.description:
RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp on which the transaction for which the expense [being] fyled was made.
This date cannot be in future.

source.description:
The name of the client app which is creating the expense.
if its a thrid party app, it prefixed with TPA_.
Ex - If you pass SLACK_APP, it will be saved as TPA_SLACK_APP. If not passed, source is saved as TPA.

currency.description:
ISO 4217 currency codes that are usually of three upper case letters.
See "https://www.iban.com/currency-codes" for examples.
If this field is ignored during a POST call to create/update an Expense, the default currency of the organization will be used.
To use other currency than default currency use `foreign_currency` field.

amount.description:
The transaction amount for which the expense was/will-be fyled. The amount will be in the currency that the organization is setup with in case of GET requests.
Note that, when used as part of creating an Expense via POST, the actual amount in the Expense, in a subsequent GET call, may get changed either because of policies or admin/approvers changing the amount.

user_amount.description: The transaction amount as claimed by user. The amount will be in the currency that the organization is setup with in case of GET requests.

policy_amount.description: The transaction amount which is modified by policy. The amount will be in the currency that the organization is setup with in case of GET requests.

admin_amount.description:
The transaction amount which is modified by admin or approver. The amount will be in the currency that the organization is setup with in case of GET requests.
This could be null if admin or approver has not edited your expense.

tax.description: Tax amount as setup by your organisation.

foreign_currency.description: The three-letter currency code following ISO standard ISO 4217. Original currency signifies the currency in which the object (expense/advance/refund/etc.) was originally created.

foreign_amount.description: Amount value of the object, in original currency i.e the currency in which the object was initially created.

creator_id.description: An unique ID, generated by Fyle, for identifying the Employee who created the object. Once an object is created, the value of this field cannot be changed and is immutable.

creator.description: Details of employee who created this expense.

category_id.description:
The unique ID of a Category to which the Expense belongs.
Use `GET /api/tpa/v1/categories` to get the list of valid ID and Name of the Categories for the organization.

This id provided by Fyle to identify a category from this organisation.
This id is unique within the organisation.

name.description: Represents the name of the category.

sub_category.description: Represents the name of the sub_category.

display_name.description:
This is a combination of name and sub_category separated by a / and spaces.
In case if no sub_category is present it is same as name of the category.

system_category.description: Represents the name of the system_category.

billable.description: This fields marks whether a given expense is billable a not.

created_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 compliant timestamp. Signifies when this object was created.

updated_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 compliant timestamp. Signifies when this object was updated.

expense_number.description:
This is user visible identifier for an expense.
This field can be used as reference in UI.

exchange_rate.description: This field determines at which rate the expenses from foriegn currency was converted to home curreny

report_id.description: Unique id given by Fyle to identify an Expense Report.

reported_at.description:
RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp on which the Expense was submitted via a Report to the Approvers.
If the Expense is not added to a Report yet or if the Report is not yet submitted, this could be null.

id.description:
This id prodvided by Fyle to uniquely identify a Expense report.
This id is always prefixed with `rp`.

approved_at.description:
RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp on which the Report was approved.
This field could be null if the Report was not yet approved.

reimbursed_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp on which the Expense was Reimbursed. If the Expense is not reimbursed yet, this could be null.

settlement_id.description: An unique ID, generated by Fyle, for identifying the Settlement. Once a Report is paid, the value of this field cannot be changed and is immutable.

settled_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp on which the report was settled.

trip_request_id.description: An ID of the TripRequest associated with it

physical_bill.description: This field indicated whether physicall bill was received or not.

physical_bill_at.description:
RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp indicating when the Expense's physicall bill was submitted.
If the Expense's bill is not required to be submitted, then this could be null.

verified.description: Indicates whether the Expense is verified or not

verified_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp on which the Expense was verified. If the Expense is not verified yet, this could be null.

vendor.description: String denoting the name of the vendor to which the Expense was made

vendor_id.description: String denoting the id of the vendor to which the Expense was made

locations.description: This field will be present for travel related categories. To add to and from location to you travel category related expenses add two locations in schema given below.

started_at.description: This field is only relevant for travel related categories. This represents the onward date.

ended_at.description: This field is only relevant for travel related categories. This represents the return date.

distance.description: Actual distance travelled by employee in mileage expenses.

calculated_distance.description: Distance compluted by Fyle in mileage expenses.

calculated_amount.description: Amount compluted by Fyle in mileage expenses.

vehicle_type.description: Type of vehicle used for travel.

rate.description: Rate per km as provided in the Fyle system

is_round_trip.description: Flag stating whether this was a round trip or not.

bus_travel_class.description: This field is applicable only for bus category.

train_travel_class.description: This field is applicable for only Train category.

flight_journey_travel_class.description: This field is applicable only for flight category. Can be `BUSINESS`, `ECONOMY`, `FIRST_CLASS`

flight_return_travel_class.description: This field is applicable only for flight category. Can be `BUSINESS`, `ECONOMY`, `FIRST_CLASS`

has_attachments.description: Returns if there are file attachments that the Expense has. Usually the image of the receipts are added as attachments to the Expenses.

attachments.description: This field will not be present in the response for the GET method on the `/api/tpa/v1/expenses` call.

id.description: Id of the file object. Always starts with `fi`.

name.description: Name of the uploaded file.

type.description: Indicates whether this file original size or encrypted or its thumbnail image.

password.description: Password which required to unlock the file.

download_path.description:
Link to download this file.
change this to right url later.

is_policy_flagged.description: This field indicates whether policy execution has flagged this expenses or not.

is_manual_flagged.description: This field indicates whether this expenses was manually flagged by approver or finance or admin.

policy_state.description:
This fields shows policy execution state for this expenses.
If this field is null then its policy has not yet run on this expenses.

external_id.description: Id given by external systems like Gmail. To identify whether that entity has been already added to Fyle or not.

personal_card_transaction.description: This key contains details about personal card transaction linked to this expense.

corporate_credit_card_transaction.description: This key contains details about corporate card transaction linked to this expense.

items.description: siginifies all the approvals of a particular object.

last_updater.description: Details of employee who updated this expense.

message.description:
This error means that the input access token is either not issued by Fyle or has expired.
You need to generate a new access token.

spent_at.description:
RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp on which the transaction for which the expense [being] fyled was made.
This date cannot be in future.

source.description:
The name of the client app which is creating the expense.
if its a thrid party app, it prefixed with TPA_.
Ex - If you pass SLACK_APP, it will be saved as TPA_SLACK_APP. If not passed, source is saved as TPA.

currency.description:
ISO 4217 currency codes that are usually of three upper case letters.
See "https://www.iban.com/currency-codes" for examples.
If this field is ignored during a POST call to create/update an Expense, the default currency of the organization will be used.
To use other currency than default currency use `foreign_currency` field.

amount.description:
The transaction amount for which the expense was/will-be fyled. The amount will be in the currency that the organization is setup with in case of GET requests.
Note that, when used as part of creating an Expense via POST, the actual amount in the Expense, in a subsequent GET call, may get changed either because of policies or admin/approvers changing the amount.

user_amount.description: The transaction amount as claimed by user. The amount will be in the currency that the organization is setup with in case of GET requests.

policy_amount.description: The transaction amount which is modified by policy. The amount will be in the currency that the organization is setup with in case of GET requests.

admin_amount.description:
The transaction amount which is modified by admin or approver. The amount will be in the currency that the organization is setup with in case of GET requests.
This could be null if admin or approver has not edited your expense.

tax.description: Tax amount as setup by your organisation.

foreign_currency.description: The three-letter currency code following ISO standard ISO 4217. Original currency signifies the currency in which the object (expense/advance/refund/etc.) was originally created.

foreign_amount.description: Amount value of the object, in original currency i.e the currency in which the object was initially created.

project_id.description: The ID generated by Fyle to uniquely identify the Project, to which the Expense belongs.

name.description: Represents the name of the project.

sub_project.description: Represents the name of the sub_project.

display_name.description:
This is a combination of name and sub_project separated by a / and spaces.
In case if no sub_project is present it is same as name of the project.

code.description: This represents the code of project.

cost_center_id.description: The ID generated by Fyle to uniquely identify the CostCenter, to which the Expense belongs.

category_id.description:
The unique ID of a Category to which the Expense belongs.
Use `GET /api/tpa/v1/categories` to get the list of valid ID and Name of the Categories for the organization.

id.description:
This id provided by Fyle to identify a category from this organisation.
This id is unique within the organisation.

name.description: Represents the name of the category.

sub_category.description: Represents the name of the sub_category.

display_name.description:
This is a combination of name and sub_category separated by a / and spaces.
In case if no sub_category is present it is same as name of the category.

system_category.description: Represents the name of the system_category.

billable.description: This fields marks whether a given expense is billable a not.

expense_number.description:
This is user visible identifier for an expense.
This field can be used as reference in UI.

exchange_rate.description: This field determines at which rate the expenses from foriegn currency was converted to home curreny

report_id.description: Unique id given by Fyle to identify an Expense Report.

reported_at.description:
RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp on which the Expense was submitted via a Report to the Approvers.
If the Expense is not added to a Report yet or if the Report is not yet submitted, this could be null.

physical_bill.description: This field indicated whether physicall bill was received or not.

physical_bill_at.description:
RFC 3339, section 5.6 "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6" compliant timestamp indicating when the Expense's physicall bill was submitted.
If the Expense's bill is not required to be submitted, then this could be null.

vendor.description: String denoting the name of the vendor to which the Expense was made

vendor_id.description: String denoting the id of the vendor to which the Expense was made

locations.description: This field will be present for travel related categories. To add to and from location to you travel category related expenses add two locations in schema given below.

started_at.description: This field is only relevant for travel related categories. This represents the onward date.

ended_at.description: This field is only relevant for travel related categories. This represents the return date.

distance.description: Actual distance travelled by employee in mileage expenses.

calculated_distance.description: Distance compluted by Fyle in mileage expenses.

calculated_amount.description: Amount compluted by Fyle in mileage expenses.

vehicle_type.description: Type of vehicle used for travel.

rate.description: Rate per km as provided in the Fyle system

is_round_trip.description: Flag stating whether this was a round trip or not.

bus_travel_class.description: This field is applicable only for bus category.

train_travel_class.description: This field is applicable for only Train category.

flight_journey_travel_class.description: This field is applicable only for flight category. Can be `BUSINESS`, `ECONOMY`, `FIRST_CLASS`

flight_return_travel_class.description: This field is applicable only for flight category. Can be `BUSINESS`, `ECONOMY`, `FIRST_CLASS`

attachments.description: This field will not be present in the response for the GET method on the `/api/tpa/v1/expenses` call.

is_enabled.description: This field specifies if the current cost center is enabled or not.

created_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 compliant timestamp. Signifies when this object was created.

updated_at.description: RFC 3339, section 5.6 compliant timestamp. Signifies when this object was updated.

last_updater_id.description: This represents the id of employee who updated this cost center.

last_updater.description: Details of employee who updated this cost center.

id.description:
This is an id prodvided by Fyle to uniquely identify an employee within an organization.
This id is always prefixed with `ou`.

user_id.description:
This id helps to identify employees in other organisations.
It is always prefixed with the string `us`.
It is unique per email.

email.description: An immutable field that represents the email address. Must be compliant with RFC 822.

code.description:
This field refers to any string that the client programs can use to refer to an employee's unique id.
This could be any field such as an UUID from an Active Directory server or employee id in a HRMS system.

business_unit.description: Represents the business unit of the organization to which of the employee belongs.

title.description: Represents the title/desgination of the employee.

mobile.description:
Mobile number of the employee.
`Given example is a fake number. We don't know who might answer your call.`
